title: Gender, Size & Color Management
content: Oh wow, you want to manage sizes and colors? This groundbreaking feature lets you define what "Large" means and whether "Blue" is actually blue. Because apparently standardized product attributes are too complex for manual entry.

title: Customers
content: Shocking concept: your customers are actual people with names and addresses. Click here to see their information, because apparently remembering who buys from you is too hard without a computer.

title: Dashboard
content: Oh, you want to see the 'big picture'? This magical button shows you colorful charts and numbers that represent how much money you're making. It's like a report card, but for grown-ups who run businesses.

title: Inventory
content: This is where you manage your 'stuff' - you know, the products you sell? Items, prices, how many you have left... basic business concepts that somehow need a special page to explain.

title: Marketing
content: The place where you pretend you know how to sell things. Create emails, discount codes, and other promotional materials that may or may not work.

title: Orders
content: People gave you money and want things in return - revolutionary! This page shows you those transactions and lets you actually send them what they paid for. Wild concept, I know.

title: Point of Sale
content: Because sometimes customers actually want to buy things in person. Revolutionary concept, I know.

title: Reports
content: For when you need the computer to tell you if you're making money or not. Features pretty graphs because apparently raw numbers are too scary for some people.

title: Settings
content: The control panel for people who think they're tech-savvy. Adjust colors, configure features, and break things that were working perfectly fine before.

title: Cancel
content: Discard changes and return to the previous screen. Any unsaved changes will be lost.

title: Cancel
content: Abandon your changes and run away. For when you realize you have no idea what you're doing.

title: Close
content: Close this window. The X button for people who can't find the X button.

title: Delete
content: Remove this forever. No undo button, so think carefully before clicking.

title: Duplicate
content: Make a copy. For when creativity is too hard and you need to recycle.

title: Export Data
content: Download as a file. Because viewing data on screen apparently isn't good enough.

title: Help
content: Get help with this feature. Because reading tooltips apparently isn't enough.

title: Import Data
content: Upload a file to add data. For spreadsheet addicts who think Excel solves everything.

title: Preview Changes
content: See changes before saving. For people who need to double-check everything.

title: Receipt Messages
content: Oh look, someone wants to customize receipt messages! This magical button opens a portal where you can craft personalized messages for different shipping methods and item categories. Because apparently "Your order is being processed" isn't exciting enough for modern customers who need their egos stroked with every transaction.

title: Reset to Default
content: Go back to original settings. Admit defeat and start over.

title: Save Changes
content: Save your changes to the database. Make sure all required fields are filled out correctly.

title: Save Changes
content: Save your changes. Click this when you're done making a mess of the settings.

title: Apply Suggested Cost
content: Let the computer guess and pretend it was your idea.

title: Add Customer
content: Create a new friend who owes you money.

title: Add New Customer
content: Create customer accounts manually. For people too lazy to make their own accounts.

title: Confirm Password
content: Type the same password again because we don't trust you to type it correctly the first time. This is that annoying but necessary step that prevents you from accidentally locking customers out of their accounts.

title: View Customer Orders
content: See what customers bought and when. Perfect for judging their life choices.

title: Search Customers
content: Find customers by name or email. Because remembering people is apparently too hard.

title: Customer Lifetime Value
content: See how much money customers have given you. Rate them by their financial contribution.

title: Delete Customer
content: Remove customers forever. For when you don't want their money anymore.

title: Edit Customer
content: Change customer information. Fix typos, update addresses, correct their mistakes.

title: Email Customer
content: Send emails directly to customers. Because picking up the phone is so 20th century.

title: Export Customers
content: Download customer data. Turn your customer list into spreadsheet format for... reasons.

title: Merge Customers
content: Two become one. Data harmony achieved.

title: New Password
content: Oh look, someone wants to change a customer's password! Enter the new password here. Must be at least 6 characters because apparently that's considered "secure" these days. Leave blank to keep their current password - revolutionary concept!

title: Search Customers
content: Hunt down that one email from 2018.

title: View Customer Profile
content: Stalk your customers legally. See their order history and personal details.

title: Generate CSS
content: Birth fresh styles from the command line.

title: Run Command
content: Push mysterious buttons and hope for green checkmarks.

title: Test CSS
content: Make sure you didn’t invent a new shade of broken.

title: Clear Query
content: Erase your brilliance. Regret immediately.

title: Describe Table
content: Peek under the hood without getting greasy.

title: Execute Query
content: Summon data with ancient SQL incantations.

title: Refresh Tables
content: Count your tables like sheep.

title: Switch Tab
content: Tabs: because one panel is never enough.

title: Add New Item
content: Create a new inventory item. Upload images and let AI help with descriptions and pricing.

title: Add New Item
content: Create a new product to sell. Fill out forms, upload pictures, set prices. Basic business stuff that somehow needs a wizard.

title: Apply Price Suggestion
content: Trust the algorithm. What could go wrong?

title: Bulk Edit
content: Change many products at once. For people who are too lazy to click each item individually.

title: Product Category
content: Group products by type. T-shirts with T-shirts, mugs with mugs... rocket science, really.

title: Clear Cost Breakdown
content: Nuke it from orbit—it’s the only way to be sure.

title: AI Cost Suggestion
content: Get AI-powered cost analysis based on materials, labor, and market data. Helps determine accurate pricing.

title: Cost Price
content: What you paid for this item. Used to calculate if you're actually making money or just pretending.

title: Delete Cost Item
content: Goodbye, questionable expense.

title: Delete Item
content: Send this SKU to the big warehouse in the sky.

title: Delete Item
content: Remove this product forever. There's no undo button, so think carefully before clicking.

title: Duplicate Item
content: Make a copy of this product. For when creativity is too hard and you need to recycle ideas.

title: Edit Item
content: Modify product details. Change prices, descriptions, pictures... try not to break anything.

title: Export Inventory
content: Download your product list as a spreadsheet. Because apparently everything needs to be in Excel.

title: Generate Marketing Copy
content: AI-generated enthusiasm—now with fewer typos.

title: Get Cost Suggestion
content: Ask the machine what it thinks money is.

title: Get Price Suggestion
content: Robot says charge more. You probably should.

title: Import Inventory
content: Upload a spreadsheet to add products. Bulk import for the spreadsheet-obsessed.

title: Navigate Items
content: Because scrolling is passé.

title: Color Templates
content: Because one shade of blue was never enough.

title: Open Cost Modal
content: Crunch the numbers so the numbers don't crunch you.

title: Global Colors
content: Centralize your rainbow like a responsible adult.

title: Marketing Manager
content: Outsource creativity to silicon.

title: AI Price Suggestion
content: AI analyzes your costs, market conditions, and competition to suggest optimal retail pricing.

title: AI Process Images
content: Let AI crop everything because rectangles are hard.

title: Refresh Categories
content: When in doubt, mash refresh. It fixes everything... eventually.

title: Reorder Point
content: When stock gets this low, you'll get nagged to order more. Because apparently planning ahead is hard.

title: Retail Price
content: What customers pay. Set it too high and nobody buys, too low and you go broke. Good luck!

title: Save Cost Item
content: Commit your math to the database like you mean it.

title: Search Items
content: Search your inventory by name, SKU, category, or description. Use filters to narrow results.

title: Stock Level
content: How many you have to sell. When this hits zero, customers see 'out of stock' and you lose money.

title: Product Tags
content: Keywords to help customers find products. Because apparently good product names aren't enough anymore.

title: View Item
content: See how this product looks to customers. Spoiler: probably not as good as you think.

title: Analytics
content: Marketing analytics and insights. More numbers and charts because apparently we don't have enough already.

title: Create Campaign
content: Announce your existence to the disinterested masses.

title: Discount Codes
content: Discount codes for customer promotions. Because apparently full price is too expensive for everyone.

title: Email Campaigns
content: Email marketing campaigns you've created. Spam, but the legal kind that people actually signed up for.

title: Generate Coupons
content: Because nothing sells like a discount and a countdown.

title: Payment Methods Chart
content: How customers pay you, marketing edition. Same pie chart, different page, because consistency is overrated.

title: Payments Pending
content: Money you're still waiting for. Like waiting for a bus that might never come.

title: Payments Received
content: Money actually in your account. The only number that really matters, but we'll show you lots of others anyway.

title: Products Sold
content: How many individual items you've sold. Each item counts separately, so one order with 3 items = 3 products sold.

title: Recent Orders Table
content: Latest orders in your system. Fresh off the digital press, still warm from the internet.

title: Sales Overview Chart
content: Another line graph showing sales over time. Because apparently one sales chart wasn't enough.

title: Top Items List
content: Your best-selling products from a marketing angle. Hint: they're the same products as on the reports page.

title: Total Customers
content: How many people are in your customer database. Not all of them will buy again, but we can pretend they will.

title: Total Orders
content: Total number of orders from your marketing perspective. Same number as everywhere else, but in a different color.

title: Total Sales
content: Total sales revenue from a marketing viewpoint. Spoiler alert: it's the same money you made, just with marketing spin.

title: Send Test Email
content: Email yourself like it's 2005.

title: Social Media
content: Social media management tools. For pretending you're an influencer when you're really just selling stuff.

title: Bulk Actions
content: Perform actions on multiple orders at once. Update status, print labels, or send notifications.

title: Cancel Order
content: Cancel this order. Sometimes things don't work out - it happens.

title: Edit Order
content: Change order details before shipping. Fix addresses, add items, correct mistakes humans inevitably make.

title: Export Orders
content: Download order data as a spreadsheet. For accountants who think Excel is the answer to everything.

title: Filter Orders
content: Sift the chaos until only the good stuff remains.

title: Fulfill Order
content: Mark as shipped and add tracking. Tell the computer you actually did your job.

title: Mark Shipped
content: Declare it shipped like a captain christening a boat.

title: Create New Order
content: Make a manual order for phone sales. Because some people still don't know how to use websites.

title: Order Status Filter
content: Filter orders by status: pending, processing, shipped, delivered, or cancelled.

title: Search Orders
content: Find specific orders. Type words, get results. It's like Google, but for your own business.

title: Order Status
content: Track progress from 'new' to 'done.' Like a progress bar for packages.

title: Payment Status
content: Track if people actually paid you. Because promises don't pay bills.

title: Print Packing Slips
content: Print shipping labels. Turn digital information into paper because apparently screens are confusing.

title: Refund Order
content: Be the hero customers deserve. Or the villain accountants fear.

title: Process Refund
content: Give money back to unhappy customers. Smile while your profits disappear.

title: Shipping Status
content: Track packages from your hands to theirs. Modern miracle of logistics.

title: View Order Details
content: Look at all the order information. Everything you need to know about this particular transaction.

title: Browse Items
content: Window-shopping, but with fewer windows.

title: Complete Sale
content: Turn tapping into revenue. Cha-ching.

title: Exit POS
content: Return to the world of tiny buttons and even tinier margins.

title: Fullscreen
content: Make the buttons comically large for dramatic effect.

title: Average Order Value
content: The average amount people spend per order. It's basic math: total money divided by number of orders. Calculator not included.

title: Change Date Range
content: Move the goalposts until the numbers look nice.

title: Export Report
content: Download a spreadsheet to ignore later.

title: Inventory Alerts
content: Warnings about products running low. Because apparently keeping track of inventory is too hard without computer reminders.

title: Orders
content: How many times people bought stuff from you. Each purchase = one order. Revolutionary counting system, I know.

title: Payment Methods Chart
content: Pretty pie chart showing how people pay you. Credit cards, cash, checks... it's like a rainbow, but for money.

title: Payments Pending
content: Money people owe you but haven't paid yet. Like IOUs, but more official and less likely to be forgotten.

title: Payments Received
content: Money you've actually received, not just promised. Because apparently there's a difference between 'ordered' and 'paid.'

title: Print Report
content: Feed your printer and your soul with paper charts.

title: Print Report
content: Turn your digital report into dead trees. For people who still think paper is superior to screens.

title: Sales Over Time Chart
content: A fancy line graph showing if you're making more or less money over time. It goes up when business is good, down when it's not. Shocking!

title: Top Selling Products
content: Your best-selling items. The stuff people actually want to buy. Pay attention to this list - it's important.

title: Total Customers
content: How many different people have given you money. Not counting the ones who just browse and leave.

title: Total Revenue
content: This big number shows how much money you've made. It's called 'revenue' - fancy word for 'money that came in.' Don't spend it all in one place.

title: Reset To Defaults
content: Ctrl+Z for your entire taste in design.

title: Account Settings
content: Change your details like a spy on the run—new names not included.

title: AI Settings
content: Configure artificial intelligence features because apparently human intelligence isn't sufficient for running a small business anymore. Let the robots help you make decisions.

title: Save AI Settings
content: Give the robot clear instructions before it 'helps'.

title: Test AI Settings
content: Make the AI perform a trick. Clap politely if it works.

title: AI & Automation Tools
content: Buttons that sound fancy and sometimes actually are.

title: Analytics & Insights
content: Pretty charts and numbers that make you feel like a data scientist. See how many people visited your site and pretend you understand what "conversion rate" means.

title: Area-Item Mapper
content: Assign specific items to clickable areas because the website can't magically know which product you want to show when someone clicks on a random spot.

title: Background Manager
content: Change your room backgrounds because apparently the current ones aren't aesthetically pleasing enough for your refined tastes. Upload new images to make your virtual rooms look "professional."

title: Business Settings
content: Configure core business information like company name, contact details, payment methods, and operational settings.

title: Business Information
content: Your public face. Make it look like you totally meant to be professional today.

title: Close
content: Retreat with dignity.

title: Save Business Info
content: Commit your 'brand voice' to the database like a responsible adult.

title: Business Reports
content: View sales reports, inventory analysis, and financial performance because staring at numbers on pretty charts makes you feel like a real business owner. Don't worry, we've made the math simple enough for you.

title: Cart Button Text
content: Customize what your "Add to Cart" buttons say. Because apparently "Add to Cart" isn't descriptive enough for modern consumers who need constant hand-holding.

title: Categories
content: Organize your products into neat little boxes because apparently chaos isn't good for business. Create categories like "T-Shirts" and "Tumblers" - revolutionary organizational concepts for the modern entrepreneur.

title: Cost Breakdown
content: Figure out why profits disappear faster than fresh donuts in a break room.

title: Global CSS Rules
content: Change colors, fonts, and buttons because apparently "make it look good" isn't specific enough instruction for you. Don't worry, we'll hold your hand through picking colors that don't make your customers' eyes bleed.

title: Close
content: Leave before you redesign the universe.

title: Save CSS Rules
content: Save your masterpiece before inspiration fades and variables multiply.

title: Dashboard Configuration
content: Customize your control center so you can ignore different metrics in style.

title: Database Tables
content: Advanced database management. View, edit, and manage all database tables directly.

title: Database Maintenance
content: Clean up your database because digital hoarding is a real problem. Optimize, backup, and pretend you understand what "database optimization" actually does.

title: Database Tables
content: Look at your database tables because spreadsheets in a web browser are apparently the pinnacle of modern technology. View, edit, and break your data with confidence.

title: Email Configuration
content: Set up email so you can actually communicate with customers. Configure SMTP settings and other technical wizardry that somehow makes the internet deliver messages.

title: Email History
content: See all the emails you've sent. Perfect for when you need to remember what promises you made to customers that you probably forgot about.

title: Close Email Settings
content: Escape the email labyrinth unscathed.

title: File Explorer
content: Browse your website files like it's 1995. Upload, download, and organize files because drag-and-drop is apparently too mainstream for serious business owners.

title: Fix Sample Email
content: Fix your sample email configuration because something went wrong and now your test emails look like digital garbage. Technology is wonderful, isn't it?

title: Global CSS Rules
content: Customize the visual appearance of your website. Change colors, fonts, spacing, and other design elements.

title: Global CSS Rules
content: For when you want to change colors and fonts without learning actual web design. It's like digital finger painting for adults.

title: Help & Hints
content: Get help with using the system. For when these snarky tooltips aren't helpful enough and you need actual useful information. Shocking!

title: Logging Status
content: peek behind the curtain and see what your site muttered under its breath.

title: Marketing Analytics
content: Track your marketing campaigns, customer acquisition, and ROI because apparently knowing if your marketing efforts are working is important for business success. Who would have thought that spending money on ads should generate results?

title: Receipt Messages
content: Add heartfelt thank-yous, or passive-aggressive reminders to keep receipts.

title: Room-Category Links
content: Link product categories to specific rooms. This determines which products appear in each room.

title: Room Mapper
content: Visual tool to map clickable areas on room images. Define where customers can click to view products.

title: Room-Category Links
content: Connect rooms to categories because the computer can't figure out that the "T-Shirts" room should show T-shirts. Amazing how technology needs your guidance for such complex logic.

title: Room Mapper
content: Draw clickable areas on room images. It's like playing connect-the-dots, except you're mapping where customers can click to see products. How thrilling.

title: Room Settings
content: Configure your virtual store rooms. Yes, your website has rooms - T-Shirts, Tumblers, Artwork - each with fancy names and descriptions. It's like interior decorating, but for nerds.

title: Sales Administration
content: Manage sales and discounts. Create "special offers" that make customers think they're getting a deal while you're still making the same profit. Marketing genius!

title: Secrets Manager
content: Store keys and secrets here, not in a sticky note under your keyboard.

title: Clear Token
content: For when you pasted the key into the wrong box. Again.

title: Save Square Settings
content: Lock in your payment destiny.

title: Square Settings
content: Connect to Square payment processing. Because handling money digitally requires special settings and configurations that somehow make sense to accountants.

title: Sync Items
content: Teach Square about your inventory, like show-and-tell but with SKUs.

title: Test Connection
content: Press to discover if the finance gods are smiling today.

title: System Cleanup
content: Clean up your system files and database. For when you've accumulated so much digital junk that your website is slower than a dial-up modem from 1999.

title: System Reference
content: Technical information about your system. Database tables, API endpoints, and other nerdy details that make you feel like a "developer."

title: System Documentation
content: Read the manual that nobody ever reads. Complete with technical details that will make your eyes glaze over within minutes.

title: Template Manager
content: Manage your templates for colors, sizes, and costs. For people who love spreadsheets so much they want them embedded in their website administration panel.

title: User Manager
content: Grant access responsibly. No, your cousin doesn’t need admin rights.

title: Website Configuration
content: The settings for your settings. Configure business info, colors, and other basic details that should have been set up months ago.
